title: Chambliss files suit in state court seeking 6th year
content: Lawyers for Ole Miss quarterback Trinidad Chambliss sued the NCAA in Mississippi court on Friday, seeking one more season of eligibility with the Rebels.

title: Mensah's candidates: Duke QB late add to portal
content: Duke starting quarterback Darian Mensah is entering the transfer portal. Mensah's decision comes less than a month after he chose to return to school instead of entering the NFL draft.

title: Seahawks HC 'really optimistic' QB Darnold plays
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald said Friday that he's "really optimistic" Sam Darnold will play Saturday against the 49ers despite a new oblique injury.

title: Lakers rule out Luka (groin) vs. Blazers on Sat.
content: Los Angeles Lakers star Luka Doncic will miss Saturday's game against the Portland Trail Blazers because of left groin soreness, the team announced Friday.

title: Rangers GM sends letter to fans signaling retool
content: New York Rangers GM Chris Drury sent a letter to fans saying that the team will embark on retooling the roster.

title: Cuse AD: College football needs 'holistic' reform
content: Syracuse AD John Wildhack is calling for serious reforms in college football, including a holistic rethinking of the calendar, collective bargaining with athletes and consolidation of TV media rights.

title: Caps GM: Ovechkin future talk will 'have to wait'
content: Washington Capitals general manager Chris Patrick says he hasn't talked much about the future with Alex Ovechkin.

title: Sources: Mets, Bichette reach 3-year, $126M deal
content: After missing out on Kyle Tucker, the Mets have agreed to a three-year, $126 million contract with Bo Bichette, sources confirmed to ESPN. New York plans to play Bichette at third base for the first time in his pro career.

content: The 56 standouts, surprises and more of a historic freshman class, starting with Cameron Boozer and AJ Dybantsa.

title: Victor Wembanyama, Keldon Johnson shaved each other's heads following loss to OKC
content: Spurs center Victor Wembanyama and forward Keldon Johnson showed up to shoot around on Thursday with bald heads.

title: Keep, cut or add? What to do with these eight rising and falling players
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upward or downward, and explains whether they should be added or cut from your roster.

title: BMC polls: Only traditional bastions back UBT-MNS‚Äôs ‚Äòsave Marathis‚Äô plank
content: In a historic attempt to unify Marathi voters in the BMC elections, the Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS alliance stumbled despite their efforts after a long hiatus. Holding onto their territories in south and central Mumbai, the Thackeray legacy struggled against the BJP's formidable push, especially in the affluent western suburbs.

title: Visa troubles! After Pakistan-origin USA players, England players cough in similar situation
content: Visa troubles ahead of the T20 World Cup in India have spread to England, with Adil Rashid and Rehan Ahmed facing delays that could rule them out of warm-up games. Earlier, four Pakistan-born USA players faced similar issues. The ECB has received assurances, while England also await clarity on their Bangladesh fixture venue.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn, now they're clashing
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: 'Gambhir fired gun ...': Ex-India player on Rohit's ODI captaincy removal
content: Manoj Tiwary has criticized Rohit Sharma's removal as ODI captain, suggesting head coach Gautam Gambhir influenced the decision. Tiwary believes selectors disrespected Rohit, who was performing well and led India to an ICC Champions Trophy win. He feels the move lacked cricketing logic and has diminished his interest in ODIs.

title: Nvidia CEO advocates zero coding for engineers; this is what he wants them to do instead
content: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

title: Marathon in Mumbai, runners in Gurgaon, Hyderabad, Darjeeling & more
content: In a remarkable display of resilience, countless individuals are taking part in the Tata Mumbai Marathon from the comfort of their homes, spanning various locations throughout India. This innovative hybrid format, a product of the pandemic's challenges, has evolved into a significant alternative, providing ease and a launchpad for future runners.

title: 'Dhurandhar' day 43: Film mints Rs 1275 crore worldwide
content: Despite facing new releases, the action-packed spy drama 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive run, entering its 76th week.  On its 43rd day, the film earned Rs 1.65 crore, outperforming new releases 'Happy Patel: Katarnak Jasoos' and 'Rahu Ketu', showcasing its enduring box office strength.

title: BJP takes control of Mumbai for first time, but needs Shinde Sena for majority
content: In a stunning political shift, the BJP has taken control of Mumbai's Municipal Corporation (BMC), effectively ending the Thackeray family's nearly thirty-year dominance over the city's civic governance. The Mahayuti coalition, spearheaded by the BJP alongside Eknath Shinde's faction of the Shiv Sena, has surpassed the majority threshold, with the BJP poised to appoint the new mayor.

title: 'Detrimental to growth': Ex-India coach questions Sooryavanshi playing U19 WC
content: Former India coach WV Raman cautioned against overexposing 14-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi at the U-19 level, emphasizing long-term development over immediate success.  Despite his IPL debut and strong performances, Raman believes this level might hinder his growth.  Meanwhile, India began their U-19 World Cup campaign with a win against the USA, though Sooryavanshi had a quiet outing with the bat.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Stephen Curry's 2-word message as Klay passes Lillard on 3s list
content: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: Travis Kelce sparks tension with Taylor Swift amid post-football life stress
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about Travis Kelce‚Äôs emotional well-being as he considers retirement from the NFL. Insiders say football has long defined Kelce‚Äôs identity, making the transition difficult. While opportunities await beyond the game, the uncertainty has created stress. Kelce has acknowledged the challenge publicly while evaluating his physical readiness and future.

title: Tech wreck: Job cuts at TCS drag Big 5 IT firms' net hiring to 17 in 9 months
content: Slowdown In Client Spends, AI-Led Productivity Pressures Reduce Need For Junior, Mid-Level Talent | Cos Added 18K Jobs A Year Ago

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Fadnavis, Thackerays & Pawars - top 10 winners & losers
content: Maharashtra's civic elections saw a significant political shift as the BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a dominant victory, particularly in Mumbai's BMC. Devendra Fadnavis and the BJP celebrated substantial gains, ending Shiv Sena's long-held control. Uddhav Thackeray's Sena and the Congress faced major setbacks, while Raj Thackeray's MNS and Sharad Pawar's NCP also saw diminished influence.

title: 'Pure heart amid QB retirement buzz': Joe Burrow‚Äôs girlfriend Olivia Ponton
content: Joe Burrow, the Cincinnati Bengals' star player, has sparked panic among fans after he made a few controversial statements which hints at opting for retirement. Amid all the mess, his rumored girlfriend, popular model and influencer, Olivia Ponton, has spoken out on how she builds her confidence and kindness as she stays away from discussing her romance with Joe Burrow in public.

title: Maha civic polls: BJP dominates, AIMIM expands, Cong finds foothold - 5 key takeaways
content: The BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a decisive victory in the Maharashtra civic elections 2026, including the BMC polls, across 27 civic bodies. Key takeaways highlight the BJP's dominance under Devendra Fadnavis, the erosion of the Thackeray legacy, and the fizzling out of Ajit Pawar's political maneuvers. The Congress showed a minor resurgence, while AIMIM made notable inroads in urban pockets.

title: Quote of the day by Zendaya: 'Just because someone has inflicted hurt...'
content: In an inspiring moment in 2015, Zendaya, the talented actress and dedicated philanthropist, conveyed a vital lesson about self-respect and ethics, stating that causing pain to others is never warranted, even in the face of injustice.

title: RCB remain unbeaten with dominant win over Gujarat Giants
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru achieved their third consecutive victory in the Women's Premier League. They defeated Gujarat Giants by 32 runs. A significant partnership between Radha Yadav and Richa Ghosh bolstered RCB's score. Shreyanka Patil delivered a stellar bowling performance, taking five wickets. This win solidifies RCB's strong position in the tournament.

title: Cavs vs 76ers prediction, best props, moneyline and odds (Jan 16)
content: The Cleveland Cavaliers face the Philadelphia 76ers on January 16, 2026, in a crucial Eastern Conference matchup. With injuries impacting both rosters, Donovan Mitchell and Tyrese Maxey will carry significant offensive loads. Philadelphia, a slight home favorite, aims to leverage their home court advantage despite Cleveland's recent success in their head-to-head series.

title: X outage: Musk‚Äôs Twitter goes down for second time in three days
content: X, formerly Twitter, experienced a significant global outage on Friday, January 16, marking the second disruption in three days. Users worldwide faced issues accessing posts, photos, and videos, with a majority reporting app problems.  This latest technical fault adds to a string of disruptions affecting the platform recently, leaving many unable to connect.

title: Maha civic polls: BJP trolls Raj Thackeray with order of 'rasmalai', Annamalai serves jab
content: In a light-hearted twist following the BJP's victory in the Maharashtra civic elections, MP PC Mohan cheekily took a dig at Raj Thackeray by referencing 'rajmalai'. This comes on the heels of Thackeray‚Äôs playful jab at K Annamalai, calling him 'rasmalai' during a spirited debate on Mumbai's essence.

title: ‚ÄòIt is none of her business‚Äô: Priya Sachdev plea slammed by Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs sister
content: Priya Sachdev Kapur has approached the Supreme Court seeking divorce documents from Sunjay Kapur and Karisma Kapoor's marriage. This move is seen by Sunjay's sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, as a deliberate distraction from the ongoing Rs 30,000 crore estate dispute and allegations of a forged will.

title: Quote of the day by JLo: 'Can‚Äôt have love without heartbreak'
content: Jennifer Lopez shared a profound insight during her Las Vegas residency, stating that love inherently involves heartbreak, a risk one accepts. She emphasized that relationships are a package deal, requiring strength to endure pain alongside joy. This reflects her personal growth and newfound self-love, asserting that any future partner must accept her fully and treat her right.

title: Kashmir sees fresh snowfall in higher reaches; tourist rush triggers traffic snarls
content: This led to traffic jams as many visitors flocked to the resort to enjoy the snow. Numerous vehicles were stranded due to the ongoing snowfall, prompting assistance from police and CRPF personnel, officials added

content: Uttar Pradesh has seen the largest number of voters deleted from the first draft of the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. Sreeparna Chakrabarty tracks down a few of the 2.89 crore left out of the list, some of whom migrated out of U.P. and some who have shifted houses within the State. Migrant workers from other States who had been registered in two locations must now choose one

A massive operation involving more than 100 forest personnel is under way to track the animal.¬†Amit Bhelari¬†reports on the attacks, which have led to panic in the villages, and the ongoing search

content: The alleged lack of commitment among doctors and the absence of critical facilities such as sample collection continue to affect the functioning of Urban Health and Wellness Centres

title: Narcotics cases on an upward spiral in Kerala
content: In Kochi, the number of cases under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act have shot up from 1,268 in 2020 to 6,914 in 2025. The pattern is similar in many other districts in the State. Enforcers are relentless in their hunt, but the peddlers mostly manage to outwit them with innovative means. G. Ragesh details how the outcome is proving detrimental to the young people in the State

title: Fadnavis hails ‚Äòpeople‚Äôs trust‚Äô as Mahayuti leads Maharashtra polls
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday hailed the ‚Äúpeople‚Äôs trust‚Äù in the BJP‚ÄìShiv Sena Mahayuti after the alliance recorded a sweeping victory in Maharashtra‚Äôs civic body elections. The Mahayuti dominated polls across the State, including the high-profile Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, and is set to form mayors in 25 of the 29 municipal corporations. Fadnavis attributed the strong mandate to the alliance‚Äôs development-focused governance agenda.

title: ED seizes cash from premises of minor mineral mafias in Odisha
content: Premises searched belong to brokers, mafias, gangsters, local strongmen involved in illegal mining of sand, black stone, other minerals in Ganjam district, exploiting and terrorising residents, ED says

title: "Public's Mandate Is Supreme": Ajit Pawar Accepts Defeat In Civic Polls
content: Following the near-clear results of the 29 municipal corporation elections in Maharashtra, Deputy Chief Minister and NCP chief Ajit Pawar has officially conceded defeat in several key urban centres.

title: Delhi Police Issues Traffic Advisory Ahead Of Republic Day Parade Rehearsals
content: Traffic movement will be restricted at several key crossings in Delhi on January 17, 19, 20 and 21 due to rehearsals for the Republic Day parade along Kartavya Path, police said on Friday.

title: 14,000 Buses, 36,000 EV Chargers: Delhi's 4-Year Pollution Plan
content: The Delhi government on Friday laid out a four-year, deadline-driven plan to cut air pollution, placing its biggest bets on public transport, electric vehicles and aggressive dust control, while fixing clear timelines to clear the capital's three lan

title: Suspecting Affair, Man Kills Sister-In-Law, Neighbour In UP
content: A 35-year-old man in UP's Fatehpur district allegedly killed his neighbour and his sister-in-law, suspecting them of being involved in a relationship, police said on Friday.

title: US Warns Of "Military Activities" Over Mexico, Central America
content: US aviation authorities issued notices Friday warning airlines to "exercise caution" in the airspace over Mexico and Central America due to "military activities."

title: India, Japan Launch AI Dialogue, Joint Working Group On Critical Minerals
content: India and Japan unveiled new initiatives to push bilateral cooperation in the sector of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and critical minerals during the 18th Strategic Dialogue between the two countries.

title: ChatGPT's Free Ride Is Ending As OpenAI Plans For Advertising
content: OpenAI says it will soon start showing advertisements to ChatGPT users who aren't paying for a premium version of the chatbot.

title: EU Advises Airlines To Avoid Iranian Airspace Amid Unrest
content: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency on Friday advised airlines to avoid Iranian airspace, after threats of US attacks that have put the Islamic republic on guard.

title: Trump Offers Egypt To Mediate On Ethiopia Dam
content: US President Donald Trump told Egypt on Friday he was ready to reopen diplomacy to press Ethiopia into sharing water from a mega-dam that has angered Cairo.

title: Venezuela Beginning "Transition" To Democracy, Says Maria Machado
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said Friday her country is starting a "true transition" to democracy and will become free with support from the United States and President Donald Trump.

title: Exiled Prince Reza Pahlavi Urges World To Act As Iran Nears Collapse
content: Iran's exiled crown prince Reza Pahlavi urged the international community to take urgent action against Iran's ruling establishment, saying the Islamic Republic was "close to collapse" and that global inaction would only increase the loss of life.

title: BJP, Sena Win BMC Polls, Thackerays Lose Grip On Richest Civic Body
content: The BJP-led alliance is headed for a victory in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections as the Thackerays lose grip on Mumbai's civic body after 25 years, with votes still being counted in 29 civic bodies across Maharashtra.

title: 'Democratic Iran Would Seek Closer Ties With India': Exiled Prince Reza Pahlavi
content: Iran's exiled crown prince, Reza Pahlavi, on Friday said that a democratic Iran would seek close and cooperative relations with India.

title: Rs 1,000-Crore Illicit Funds Routed Via Mule Accounts, CBI Charges 19

title: "I Will Return, Islamic Republic Will Fall": Iran's Exiled Crown Prince
content: The son of Iran's late shah said Friday he was confident the Islamic republic would fall in the face of mass protests and called for intervention.

title: Mumbai Chose Development, Voted Against Those In Power For 25 Years: E Shinde
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Friday the people of Mumbai have voted against those in power for 25 years and opted for "development brand", in a dig at the Thackeray cousins Raj and Uddhav.

title: 47-Year-Old Kolkata Woman Dies Due To Altitude Sickness In North Sikkim
content: A 47-year-old woman from Kolkata died while vacationing in the high-altitude North Sikkim on Friday, officials said.

title: "Mumbaikars Chose Substance Over Divisiveness":  K Annamalai
content: Reacting to his party's victory in the civic polls in Maharashtra, BJP leader K Annamalai on Friday said people trust the triple-engine leadership and they have rejected "divisive propaganda.

title: As BJP Eyes Mumbai Mayor Post, Shinde Sena Could Throw Spanner In Works: Sources
content: As of midnight, the BJP had emerged as the single largest party, but there is no scenario - barring implausible ones like a tie-up with Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena - in which it can govern the corporation without the support of Shinde's Shiv Sena.

title: Refunds For December Disruptions Processed, IndiGo Tells Aviation Regulator
content: Domestic carrier IndiGo has processed refunds to all passengers affected by flight cancellations between December 3 and 5, aviation safety regulator DGCA said on Friday.

title: Raptors weigh big deadline moves as RJ Barrett, Quickley hit trade talks
content: The Toronto Raptors face a trade deadline dilemma, balancing contention with rebuilding.  Discussions for Domantas Sabonis with the Kings are stalled due to salary concerns, while the Raptors explore packages involving RJ Barrett and Immanuel Quickley.  A potential four-team deal could send Sabonis to Toronto, with other assets moving to Sacramento.

content: Ministry of External Affairs says interactions with political interlocutors in Dhaka are part of regular diplomatic engagement

title: India, Japan decide to ramp up dialogue on economic security
content: jaishankar and toshimitsu Motegi chaired the 18th India-Japan strategic dialogue . both sides agreed to boost cooperation in AI and critical minerals . a decision to establish a Japan-India AI strategic dialogue and ramp up dialogue between the private sectors and govts on issues related to economic security .

title: Three terror hideouts busted in J&K‚Äôs Kathua
content: the first hideout was busted in Kamad Nallah area on Jan 8 . two more were discovered in billawar, about 80km away . a massive cordon-and-search operation has been underway in the region since Jan 7 .

title: Can't use law to scuttle Parliamentary process, says SC, rejects Varma's plea
content: Yashwant Varma's plea against the Lok Sabha Speaker's decision to appoint a committee on the motion to remove him was rejected . it said the speaker has committed no illegality . but the manner in which the notice of motion was processed at the secretariat level does not fully align with the role contemplated under the law .

title: Power Rankings: SEC shaping national title race
content: the day-to-day challenges of January are key in putting that picture together . the AP-ranked SEC currently has nine teams battling each other for supremacy . they have already met this season in a game that didn't count in the standings .

title: 2026 draft: Which underclassmen have declared?
content: the 2026 draft is three months away, so the class is starting to take shape . the deadline for underclassmen to declare for this draft class was January 14 . players from both teams meet in the college football playoff national championship .

title: Kompany's Bayern Munich chasing history, as Reyna looks to improve
content: Vincent Kompany beat K√∂ln 3-1 to equalise pep Guardiola's Bundesliga record . he was keen to swat aside comparisons between himself and his boss . Bayern now have 66 goals and are almost certain to smash 101 goals across a single campaign .

title: Ranking the top 25 women's players midway through 2025-26
content: Sarah Strong topped ESPN's preseason ranking of the 25 best players in women's college basketball for 2025-26 . she hasn't budged since, but the rest of the list has changed a lot . the SEC is the top conference with 13 players appearing on the midseason list .

title: Power Rankings: How far Michigan, Iowa State, Vanderbilt drop after losses
content: the Wolverines and Cyclones have a long list of blowout victories . they own a 23-point road rout at Purdue . a shuffle in ESPN's Power Rankings has prompted a massive drop .

title: Rams-Bears set to join list of coldest playoff games
content: temperatures could drop to single digits for divisional round game between los Angeles Rams and the Chicago Bears . if 2 degrees is where we end up, the Rams-Bears still won't be among the top five coldest playoff games . the 1967 NFL championship reigns supreme as the coldest postseason game .

title: Plan to buy 114 Rafale jets gets nod of defence procurement board
content: the proposal to acquire 114 Rafale fighter jets from French manufacturer Dassault Aviation could be valued at around Rs 3.25 lakh crore . the proposal will now be placed before the Defence Acquisition Council (DAC), chaired by defence minister Rajnath Singh .

title: In next 10 years, India should lead startup trends and tech: PM Modi
content: PM Modi and Union minister Piyush Goyal attend an event to mark the 10th anniversary of Startup India initiative in New Delhi on Friday Atul Mathur is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India with over 27 years of experience in journalism. Based in Delhi, he has spent much of his career reporting on governance, public policy and politics, churning out researched, data-driven stories that impact daily lives. Atul is known for investigative depth and strong human-interest narratives as he strives to bring clarity and context to complex issues. He currently tracks the energy sector, writing on power, renewable energy, coal and mines. title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days
content: the league's three-week sprint to the Feb. 5 trade deadline is here . many contenders are still deciding on a direction . a weekly trip around the Association focuses on those teams trying to add to their rosters .

title: In touch with US on Chabahar port sanctions waiver: Govt
content: govt: "we remain engaged with the US side in working out this arrangement" to isolate Iran, the US state department had in Sept revoked the sanctions exception issued in 2018 for the port India has developed for its access to Afghanistan and central Asia . the revocation was meant to come into effect on Sept 29 but was extended later by the US .

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's midseason fantasy MVP
content: we're identifying the midseason fantasy hockey MVP for all 32 clubs . it's not too late to sign up for ESPN Fantasy Hockey . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: three years, $126 million with opt-outs after first two seasons Grade: B- The new york Mets have a new heart .
